Description: Foot and tondo sherd of Attic black-figured pottery stemless cup with heavy flaring foot; fillet at junction of bowl and foot; interior: small reserved tondo, with three dilute bands at perimeter; in tondo, black-figure decoration consisting of Triton figure to right, body ending in fish’s tail (added red stripe running lengthwise), wearing a sleeveless jerkin in red, and holding a fish in his left hand; exterior glazed save for outside of foot ring; stand-ring reserved, and underside; inside of foot glazed; four repair holes drilled through wall of foot (and one aborted).
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding Triton in the tondo, see Berlin F 1755 by the C Painter in Brijder, H. A. G., Siana Cups I and Komast Cups. Amsterdam 1983, pl. 18, no. 59; Hanover 1959.1 (Bridjer 1983, pl. 29, no. 126: Taras Painter) and Athens, Agora P3853 in Agora XXIII, pl. 111, no.1697. See also British Museum 1886,0401.1226.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B600.23)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0671) (Phase 1)
